Items.name: Adversities
Items.definition: A difficult or unpleasant situation.

Items.name: Advice
Items.definition: Guidance or recommendations offered with regard to prudent future action.

Items.name: Allies
Items.definition: A state formally cooperating with another for a military or other purpose.

Items.name: Ambush
Items.definition: A surprise attack by people lying in wait in a concealed position.

Items.name: Anger
Items.definition: A strong feeling of annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.

Items.name: Animals
Items.definition: A living organism that feeds on organic matter, typically having specialized sense organs and nervous system and able to respond rapidly to stimuli.

Items.name: Art
Items.definition: The expression or application of human creative skill and imagination, typically in a visual form such as painting or sculpture, producing works to be appreciated primarily for their beauty or emotional power.

Items.name: Attention
Items.definition: Notice taken of someone or something; the regarding of someone or something as interesting or important.

Items.name: Balance
Items.definition: An even distribution of weight enabling someone or something to remain upright and steady.

Items.name: Benefits
Items.definition: An advantage or profit gained from something.

Items.name: Burden
Items.definition: A load, typically a heavy one.

Items.name: Bureaucracy
Items.definition: A system of government in which most of the important decisions are made by state officials rather than by elected representatives.

Items.name: Business
Items.definition: A person's regular occupation, profession, or trade.

Items.name: Competition
Items.definition: The activity or condition of competing.

Items.name: Danger
Items.definition: The possibility of suffering harm or injury.

Items.name: Death
Items.definition: The action or fact of dying or being killed; the end of the life of a person or organism.

Items.name: Dispute
Items.definition: A disagreement, argument, or debate.

Items.name: Disruption
Items.definition: Disturbance or problems which interrupt an event, activity, or process.

Items.name: Dreams
Items.definition: A series of thoughts, images, and sensations occurring in a person's mind during sleep.

Items.name: Elements
Items.definition: An essential or characteristic part of something abstract.

Items.name: Emotions
Items.definition: A strong feeling deriving from one's circumstances, mood, or relationships with others.

Items.name: Enemies
Items.definition: A person who is actively opposed or hostile to someone or something.

Items.name: Energy
Items.definition: The strength and vitality required for sustained physical or mental activity.

Items.name: Environment
Items.definition: The surroundings or conditions in which a person, animal, or plant lives or operates.

Items.name: Evil
Items.definition: Profound immorality and wickedness, especially when regarded as a supernatural force.

Items.name: Expectations
Items.definition: A strong belief that something will happen or be the case.

Items.name: Extravagance
Items.definition: Lack of restraint in spending money or use of resources.

Items.name: Factor
Items.definition: A circumstance, fact, or influence that contributes to a result or outcome.

Items.name: Failure
Items.definition: Lack of success.

Items.name: Fame
Items.definition: The state of being known or talked about by many people, especially on account of notable achievements.

Items.name: Fears
Items.definition: An unpleasant emotion caused by the threat of danger, pain, or harm.

Items.name: Food
Items.definition: Any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink or that plants absorb in order to maintain life and growth.

Items.name: Friendship
Items.definition: The emotions or conduct of friends; the state of being friends.

Items.name: Goals
Items.definition: (in soccer, rugby, hockey, and some other games) a pair of posts linked by a crossbar and typically with a net between, forming a space into or over which the ball has to be sent in order to score.

Items.name: Good
Items.definition: That which is morally right; righteousness.

Items.name: Home
Items.definition: The place where one lives permanently, especially as a member of a family or household.

Items.name: Hope
Items.definition: A feeling of expectation and desire for a certain thing to happen.

Items.name: Ideas
Items.definition: A thought or suggestion as to a possible course of action.

Items.name: Illness
Items.definition: A disease or period of sickness affecting the body or mind.

Items.name: Illusions
Items.definition: An instance of a wrong or misinterpreted perception of a sensory experience.

Items.name: Information
Items.definition: Facts provided or learned about something or someone.

Items.name: Innocent
Items.definition: A pure, guileless, or naive person.

Items.name: Inside
Items.definition: The inner side or surface of something.

Items.name: Intellectual
Items.definition: A person possessing a highly developed intellect.

Items.name: Intrigues
Items.definition: The secret planning of something illicit or detrimental.

Items.name: Investment
Items.definition: The action or process of investing money for profit or material result.

Items.name: Jealousy
Items.definition: The state or feeling of being jealous.

Items.name: Joy
Items.definition: A feeling of great pleasure and happiness.

Items.name: Leadership
Items.definition: The action of leading a group of people or an organization.

Items.name: Legal
Items.definition: Of, based on, or concerned with the law.

Items.name: Liberty
Items.definition: The state of being free within society from oppressive restrictions imposed by authority on one's way of life, behavior, or political views.

Items.name: Lies
Items.definition: The way, direction, or position in which something lies.

Items.name: Love
Items.definition: An intense feeling of deep affection.

Items.name: Magic
Items.definition: The power of apparently influencing the course of events by using mysterious or supernatural forces.

Items.name: Masses
Items.definition: A large body of matter with no definite shape.

Items.name: Messages
Items.definition: A verbal, written, or recorded communication sent to or left for a recipient who cannot be contacted directly.

Items.name: Military
Items.definition: The armed forces of a country.

Items.name: Misfortune
Items.definition: Bad luck.

Items.name: Mundane
Items.definition: Lacking interest or excitement; dull.

Items.name: Nature
Items.definition: The phenomena of the physical world collectively, including plants, animals, the landscape, and other features and products of the earth, as opposed to humans or human creations.

Items.name: News
Items.definition: Newly received or noteworthy information, especially about recent or important events.

Items.name: Opposition
Items.definition: Resistance or dissent, expressed in action or argument.

Items.name: Opulence
Items.definition: Great wealth or luxuriousness.

Items.name: Outside
Items.definition: The external side or surface of something.

Items.name: Pain
Items.definition: Physical suffering or discomfort caused by illness or injury.

Items.name: Path
Items.definition: A way or track laid down for walking or made by continual treading.

Items.name: Peace
Items.definition: Freedom from disturbance; tranquility.

Items.name: Physical
Items.definition: A medical examination to determine a person's bodily fitness.

Items.name: Plans
Items.definition: A detailed proposal for doing or achieving something.

Items.name: Pleasures
Items.definition: A feeling of happy satisfaction and enjoyment.

Items.name: Plot
Items.definition: A plan made in secret by a group of people to do something illegal or harmful.

Items.name: Portals
Items.definition: A doorway, gate, or other entrance, especially a large and imposing one.

Items.name: Possessions
Items.definition: The state of having, owning, or controlling something.

Items.name: Power
Items.definition: The ability to do something or act in a particular way, especially as a faculty or quality.

Items.name: Prison
Items.definition: A building in which people are legally held as a punishment for a crime they have committed or while awaiting trial.

Items.name: Project
Items.definition: An individual or collaborative enterprise that is carefully planned to achieve a particular aim.

Items.name: Public
Items.definition: Ordinary people in general; the community.

Items.name: Randomness
Items.definition: The quality or state of lacking a pattern or principle of organization; unpredictability.

Items.name: Reality
Items.definition: The world or the state of things as they actually exist, as opposed to an idealistic or notional idea of them.

Items.name: Representative
Items.definition: A person chosen or appointed to act or speak for another or others.

Items.name: Riches
Items.definition: Material wealth.

Items.name: Rumor
Items.definition: A currently circulating story or report of uncertain or doubtful truth.

Items.name: Spiritual
Items.definition: A religious song of a kind associated with black Christians of the southern US, and thought to derive from the combination of European hymns and African musical elements by black slaves.

Items.name: Stalemate
Items.definition: A situation in which further action or progress by opposing or competing parties seems impossible.

Items.name: Status Quo
Items.definition: The existing state of affairs, especially regarding social or political issues.

Items.name: Success
Items.definition: The accomplishment of an aim or purpose.

Items.name: Suffering
Items.definition: The state of undergoing pain, distress, or hardship.

Items.name: Tactics
Items.definition: An action or strategy carefully planned to achieve a specific end.

Items.name: Technology
Items.definition: The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry.

Items.name: Tension
Items.definition: The state of being stretched tight.

Items.name: Travel
Items.definition: The action of traveling.

Items.name: Trials
Items.definition: A formal examination of evidence by a judge, typically before a jury, in order to decide guilt in a case of criminal or civil proceedings.

Items.name: Vehicle
Items.definition: A thing used for transporting people or goods, especially on land, such as a car, truck, or cart.

Items.name: Victory
Items.definition: An act of defeating an enemy or opponent in a battle, game, or other competition.

Items.name: War
Items.definition: A state of armed conflict between different nations or states or different groups within a nation or state.

Items.name: Weapons
Items.definition: A thing designed or used for inflicting bodily harm or physical damage.

Items.name: Weather
Items.definition: The state of the atmosphere at a place and time as regards heat, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.

Items.name: Wishes
Items.definition: A desire or hope for something to happen.

Items.name: Wounds
Items.definition: An injury to living tissue caused by a cut, blow, or other impact, typically one in which the skin is cut or broken.
